A rushed engineer generated RSA keys with both p and q as Blum integers. The encrypted access code is: 1079366866653105342209178139527572123477537524039524867623966414366015784381275925161385635353038956844607663897422455281443945149648070026595970742114278. Can you crack their mistake?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6251251402752106878597816964990036186882098728699601848547936311332202058259861937105089710391255760742823642276327137236955478741479653576497846874969029, e=5692517729572994818652583990665519560011823883313181199324125793616801356377421244570692668792643042538842148435944575056136744139039942076462542709465803
The lower 104 bits of p are: 78520426935327449222835994160067878863


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{nj6vctpe}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1079366866653105342209178139527572123477537524039524867623966414366015784381275925161385635353038956844607663897422455281443945149648070026595970742114278
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6251251402752106878597816964990036186882098728699601848547936311332202058259861937105089710391255760742823642276327137236955478741479653576497846874969029, e=5692517729572994818652583990665519560011823883313181199324125793616801356377421244570692668792643042538842148435944575056136744139039942076462542709465803
The lower 104 bits of p are: 78520426935327449222835994160067878863

extra_info: p=60528836476332773877341315024973362796178371573262397473460331222255842205647, q=103277243817438862571728042073802555938472431844201973036083629856656103998507, Ï†(n)=6251251402752106878597816964990036186882098728699601848547936311332202058259698131024795938754806691385724866357592486433538014370970109615418934928764876
subtype: blum_integers
archetype: rsa
